intro: Euphoria chevalieri, commonly known as the Chevalier's euphoria, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its blooming period typically occurs during the spring and early summer months. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
